news.title: The Fed is stuck in neutral as it watches how Trump’s policies play out
news.summary: The only gear the central bank really can be in these days is  neutral. With an abundance of unknowns, the only gear it can really be in is neutral.

news.title: Warren Buffett amasses more cash and sells more stock, but doesn't explain why in annual letter
news.summary: Buffett: "The great majority of your money remains in equities" "That preference won't change," he says. "That's the way it's always been," Buffett says.

news.title: Germans head to the polls in critical election with far-right gains expected
news.summary: Germans are voting in the 2025 federal election on Sunday, with a leadership change all but guaranteed. Germans are voting for a new government in 2025, and a new leader is all but certain.

news.title: Top Wall Street analysts are bullish on these dividend stocks
news.summary: TipRanks' analyst ranking service highlights three dividend-paying stocks, including McDonald's and Ares Capital. TipRanks: McDonald's, Ares Capital are three of the best dividend paying stocks.

news.title: Westinghouse sees path to building cheaper nuclear plants after costly past
news.summary: Westinghouse Electric Company still sees the potential for new U.S. plants. Two nuclear projects in the South were bogged down by costly overruns.

news.title: ‘She’s still waiting by the phone’: My grandmother gave her life savings to a man she met online. What now?
news.summary: “Up until the moment she was scammed, we considered her the wealthy one in our family,” the victim's family said. “We considered her to be one of the richest people in the world.”

news.title: ‘I believe myself to be an honorable person’: Do I have the right to ask my husband if I’ll inherit his house after he dies?
news.summary: “He and his first wife have a son who just graduated from university,” his daughter says. “He’s always been very proud of his son.”

news.title: ‘I’ve opened a hornet’s nest’: My mother-in-law lists my husband as beneficiary on her $1 million IRA. But her will says otherwise. Which wins?
news.summary: “All of this is causing a lot of turmoil in the family. Does her will trump the IRA beneficiary?” he asks.

news.title: Warren Buffett, warning of ‘scoundrels’ and ‘fiscal folly,’ slashes his exposure to U.S. stocks
news.summary: The “Oracle of Omaha” has become a “committed” and “long-term” investor in a handful of Japanese companies.

news.title: Videogame giants are spending more money but losing players — and profits
news.summary: Sony, Electronic Arts and Ubisoft reflect an industrywide misunderstanding (or perhaps disregard) of what gamers value. Sony, Electronic EA and Ubisoft reflects an industry wide misunderstanding ( or perhaps disregard of what gamer value)
